oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Poets and Prophets - Lori McKenna - 2018-03-03
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: An interview program on the career and life to date of songwriter Lori McKenna from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on March 3, 2018. Includes selected audio excerpts, audio from video and performances. Moderated by Michael Gray.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Lori McKenna;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (03:18) Opening comments and introduction of Michael Gray by Abi Tapia / (04:59) Introduction of Lori McKenna by Michael Gray and announcement of past Poet and Prophet songwriters in the audience / (09:52) Opening comments by Lori / (10:01) Performs Humble And Kind / (13:59) Talks about the song Humble And Kind and the writing of it / (16:36) Talks about the emotion used in songs / (17:40) Talks about sending the song to Tim McGraw / (18:34) Talks about the values espoused in the song Humble And Kind / (19:20) Talks about her childhood / (20:55) Talks about her hometown Stoughton, Massachusetts / (22:46) Talks about her mother dying when she was young / (23:57) Talks about the song Leaving This Life / (25:18) Talks about her brothers and her father's influence on her / (26:46) Talks about writing a song about her Dad / (28:14) Introduces the next song written about her Dad / (28:40) Performs People Get Old / (32:21) Talks about the last song /

(32:47) Talks about her upcoming record produced by Dave Cobb called The Tree / (33:54) Talks about her musical background and songwriting history / (36:05) Talks about the music she heard growing up / (36:40) Talks about the first time she performed in public with her songs and getting started as a songwriter / (39:50) Introduction of Mary Gauthier / (39:23) Talks about Mary and Melanie Howard and getting her songs to Faith Hill / (42:34) Talk about Faith Hill's Firefly album and getting a national stage by being on the Oprah Winfrey show and the CMA Awards show with Faith / (43:35) Plays video of these appearances on TV / (47:25) Talks about the previously screened footage / (48:06) Talks about how she felt about appearing on TV and her seemingly sudden success / (50:11) Introduces two of her children in attendance / (50:45) Talks about the Tim and Faith Soul2Soul tour and how she balances being a Mother with show business /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: McKenna, Lori; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
